title: Album Page, "Sketch of Iron Gate, Possibly Italy?", late 19th century
medium: Graphite with trace of brush with blue and gray wash on very smooth, thick, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 131; bottom right corner: 124; upper center: a half by a quarter / then door is ....
dimensions: Sheet: 31.8 x 12.4 cm (12 1/2 x 4 7/8 in.), irregular
description: Narrow sheet that has been cut down from a larger sheet and tipped vertically into binding depicting a section of an iron gate with interlocking scroll ornament and stylized ornament like a fleur-de-lis.  Above is a very light sketch of a colonnaded classical building with triangular pediment, and there is another sketch of intersecting horizontal and vertical members below this, possibly related to the larger sketch of ironwork.  The sheet is made of multiple thickness of paper that seem to have been laminated together. The bottom right corner of the sheet is separating. There are various inscriptions with measurements.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sketch of Iron Gate, Possibly Italy?", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Graphite with trace of brush with blue and gray wash on very smooth, thick, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-319.
